meanings.definition: To join hands as a symbol of betrothal or marriage.
meanings.sent1: At the wedding, the couple will handfast to show their commitment.
meanings.sent2: They decided to handfast in front of their families and friends.
meanings.sent3: The tradition of handfasting goes back many generations.
meanings.sent4: Their love was handfasted in a beautiful ceremony.
meanings.sent5: The couple's hands were handfasted together with a ribbon.

meanings.definition: A pledge or promise made by joining hands.
meanings.sent1: The handfast between them sealed their agreement.
meanings.sent2: The handshake was more than a greeting, it was a handfast.
meanings.sent3: Their handfast was a sign of their friendship.
meanings.sent4: The handfast was a solemn vow between them.
meanings.sent5: The handfast was a symbol of their trust and loyalty.

meanings.definition: Firmly secured or fastened by hand.
meanings.sent1: The handfast knot held the rope in place.
meanings.sent2: She made sure the package was handfast before sending it.
meanings.sent3: The handfast lock kept their belongings safe.
meanings.sent4: The handfast lid wouldn't budge no matter how hard they tried.
meanings.sent5: The handfast grip ensured a steady hold on the railing.
